title: He is author of Lyotard and Greek Thought: Sophistry
and co-author and co-editor, with James Williams, of The Lyotard Reader and Guide
He researches contemporary French philosophy

note: Tauris, 2013), and co-editor of Deleuze’s Philosophical Lineage (Edinburgh University Press, 2009) and Sensorium: Aesthetics, Art, Life (Cambridge Scholars, 2007). He was the founding convenor of the Australasian Society for Continental Philosophy. His research focuses on French poststructuralist philosophy, popular culture, and film.
title: He is the author of Lyotard Reframed (I.B

note: His latest book is A Process Philosophy of Signs (Edinburgh University Press, 2016).
title: James Williams is Honorary Professor of Philosophy at the Alfred Deakin Institute for Citizenship and Globalisation, Deakin University. He has published widely on contemporary continental philosophy, particularly Deleuze and Lyotard. His many books include Lyotard: Towards a Postmodern Philosophy (Polity, 1998
and Gilles Deleuze’s Difference and Repetition: A Critical Introduction and Guide

note: Understanding Nietzscheanism (Acumen, 2011), and Lyotard and the Inhuman Condition: Reflections on Nihilism, Information, and Art (Edinburgh University Press, 2016). He is an editor of Parrhesia: A Journal of Critical Philosophy and of the translation series Groundworks (Rowman & Littlefield International).
title: Ashley Woodward is Lecturer in Philosophy at the University of Dundee. He is the author of Nihilism in Postmodernity: Lyotard, Baudrillard, Vattimo (Davies group
